name: SiebelReview: Nested MVFs
description:
Regardless of whether the MVF in the child BusComp references an MVL with a primary, secondary queries will always be generated against the child BusComp.
This can cause performance issues, particularly when the MVF is exposed on a list view.
output: This rule reports MVF having a destination field that is also an MVF in the child BusComp
rationale: An MVF has been created with a destination field that is also an MVF in the child BusComp.
remediation:
There are generally two ways of resolving the secondary queries generated by the nested MVF:
* Modify the destination field to reference a SVF.  In most cases, this involves using primary join fields in the child BusComp.
* Construct an indirect MVL.
See the occurrences section for specific recommendations.
